meanings.definition: A person who delays or procrastinates.
meanings.sent1: The delayers in our group always make us late.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the delayers for not turning in their assignments on time.
meanings.sent3: The delayers at the party were the last ones to arrive, as usual.
meanings.sent4: The delayers in the marathon were left behind by the faster runners.
meanings.sent5: The team lost the game because of the delayers who couldn't make decisions quickly.

meanings.definition: The act of delaying or putting off.
meanings.sent1: The delayers of the project caused it to be completed behind schedule.
meanings.sent2: Procrastination is a common trait among delayers.
meanings.sent3: The delayers of the meeting kept finding excuses to postpone it.
meanings.sent4: The delayers of the train departure frustrated the passengers waiting on the platform.
meanings.sent5: The delayers of the flight made everyone anxious about missing their connections.
